definition: knowing sb by their reputation can't compare to meeting them in person (idiom)
pinyin: wen2 ming2 bu4 ru2 jian4 mian4

definition: to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
(negative prefix)/not/no
as/as if/such as
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)
seeing once is better than hearing a hundred times (idiom); seeing for oneself is better than hearing from many others/seeing is believing

definition: your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)
honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
the sage presents as an ordinary person (idiom)
you can't judge a person by appearance (idiom)/you can't judge a book by its cover/often in combination 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
nice to meet you

definition: lit. I've admired you for a long time (honorific)./I've been looking forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
lit. like thunder piercing the ear/a well-known reputation (idiom)
Take what you hear to be false, only believe it when you see it (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: er3 ting1 wei2 xu1 , yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2

definition: lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run

the blessing of three lifetimes (idiom)/(courteous language) it's my good fortune...
